description: A brand new Inazuma Eleven game, returning to its roots! Play through the story mode with a new protagonist, and meet all characters from the series' long history in chronicle mode!

name: Untitled Goose Game
description:
It's a lovely morning in the village and you are a horrible goose.

Untitled Goose Game is a slapstick-stealth-sandbox, where you are a goose let loose on an unsuspecting village. Make your way around town, from peoples' back gardens to the high street shops to the village green, setting up pranks, stealing hats, honking a lot, and generally ruining everyone’s day.

name: Dragon Shadow Spell
description: Dragon Shadow Spell is a strategy RPG from Flight Plan, better known as the developers of the Summon Night games until they went bankrupt in 2010. Dragon Shadow Spell was their first attempt at self-publishing a game, and I have long wanted to see what else Flight Plan could come up with apart from Summon Night

name: The Tainted
description: The Tainted is effectively a RPG but with the slight difference in that there is more action and fighting than most other RPGs

name: Nightmare in the Toy Factory
description: This is a Children's adventure game where you must attempt to save Professor Whizz Bang from the Crawling King Snake or there will be no toys for the children at Christmas

name: King of Colosseum Green
description: King of Colosseum Green is a Japanese wrestling game, featuring the Zero-One and Pro Wrestling NOAH promotions.

name: King of Colosseum Red
description: King of Colosseum Red is a Japanese pro wrestling game featuring the All Japan Pro Wrestling, New Japan Pro Wrestling and MMA org, Pancrase Hybrid Wrestling.

name: Naval Ops: Commander
description: Naval Ops: Commander is the sequel to Naval Ops: Warship Gunner. It puts a more strategic and tactical focus on the franchise.

name: World League Soccer 2000
description: Soccer

name: Lights Out
description: Blessed by the light, Soona is the last hope of Jiruho. With might and agility, she has to face the dark forces and traps of the Netherworld to save her people from the apocalypse. She will venture inside the city’s temples to recover the fragments of the sacred mirror.

name: Sonic X-treme
description: Originally designed for the Sega Genesis, then the 32x, and finally the Saturn, Sonic X-treme was meant to be the first fully realized 3D Sonic title. It was eventually cancelled in 1997 after spending a year in development hell.

name: Extreme Rock Climbing
description: Test your strength. Climb one of 10 unique climbing walls, in three different modes.

name: Wind and Water: Puzzle Battles
description: Wind and Water: Puzzle Battles is an adventure puzzle game.

name: Detective Evangelion
description:
Detective Evangelion (Meitantei Evangelion), an adventure/strategy PS2 game published by Broccoli, follows Shinji Ikari, a detective hired by Nerv, as he attempts to uncover the truths behind a series of murders. The game was released in Japan on Jan 17, 2007 and include voices from all the original Seiyū. There were 2 editions of the game: a standard edition which included a Nerv magnifying glass/key chain if you pre-ordered; and the premium edition (about 26,040円) which included a multi-face analog watch.

You play as Shinji the detective in an adventure style gameplay, talking to the Nerv personel and other people in the environment in order to pick up clues within the conversations. The game starts as Shinji emerges from an outdoor stall with sirens blaring in the background. He then finds Rei Ayanami being attacked by a teenager with tentacles. Shinji must then fight the teenager in order to free Rei. From this point on, you pick locations and explore, the ultimate goal being to discover the identity of the killer that's committing murders all over Nerv and Tokyo-3. At each of the locations, you can interact with the people there, with the occasional action sequence or mini game. All of Shinji's friends, Gendo and Misato all appear in the game.

name: Godzilla: Battle Legends
description:
Godzilla: Battle Legends (simply referred to as "Godzilla" in North America) is a fighting game based on the Godzilla film franchise, made for the Turbo Duo in 1993, developed by Alfa System and published in the United States by Hudson Soft.

When Godzilla fights a certain foe, his appearance changes to reflect the era when he battled in certain films. For example, Godzilla looks like as he did in 1955 when he fights Anguirus, and as in 1964 when he fights Rodan. This game's sequel, Godzilla: Monster War for the SNES, features fewer monsters, with the inclusion of Biollante as a playable character and Mothra.

In single player mode, only Godzilla is playable.

name: Mia Hamm Soccer 64
description: Feel the excitement as you take the winning shot with soccer champion Mia Hamm! Be a part of Mia Hamm's All-Star team or take Mia on, as you play for the World Cup in front of thousands of animated fans. The time of day, weather, and field conditions are adjustable for the 10 stadiums that are available. Learn the art of a corner kick, a penalty kick or how to beat a goalkeeper one-on-one, and get tips from Mia that you can take with you onto the real field!

name: Jikkyou Pawafuru Puroyakyu 2001
description: Baseball

name: Drift City
description: Developed by NHN Games Corporation, Drift City is a free to play arcade style racer available on ijji.com for North American users. It opts out of a realistic look for a more stylized cell shaded look.

name: Soccer America International Cup
description: A regular soccer game with some flaws in gameplay and AI. Good entertainment but not very lasting.

name: Shinseiki Evangelion 2: Evangelions
description: Sin descripción

name: Galactic Command - Excalibur
description: Galactic Command - Excalibur is a space combat sim.

name: Spinner Prologue
description: Use your Ipod or Iphone's accelerometer to get through the treacherous mazes

name: Silent Death Online
description: Mythic Entertainment's Silent Death Online was a top down arena style space shooter MMO involving players earning money by taking out other players. With this money you could upgrade you ship with many different weapons or buy a better spaceship plus the mouse and keyboard controls kept the game fast paced and fun.

name: Women's Volleyball Championship
description: Play as one of 12 countries as you battle your way to the top of the volleyball ranks in Women's Volleyball Championship.

name: reMovem
description: Match up colored orbs by tapping groups of 2 or more to remove them from the field to score in this classic iPhone/iPod Touch game.

name: Pop'n Music Animelo
description: Pop'n Music Animelo (Pop'n Music アニメロ) is a rhythm video game developed by Konami and released on Arcade platforms in March 2000 in Japan. The game was later released on PlayStation under the name Pop'n Music: Animation Melody in July 2000 in Japan. It is a spinoff entry in the Pop'n Music series.

name: Super Robot Taisen Alpha
description: Super Robot Taisen Alpha is the second game in the series to be built from the ground up for the Playstation, and is the start of the Alpha series. Alpha is the first SRW to feature the highly choreographed animation that the series is known for.

name: Race Mania
description: Race Mania is an arcade racing game features top-down camera with fast gameplay. The game has numerous tracks and vehicles to choose from and there are various gameplay modes, including single race and various championships.

name: Enigma 7
description: Enter the magical world of Enigma 7 and complete a series of challenges to save your girlfriend Jane.

name: Pop'n Music Party
description: The 16th game in the Pop'n Music franchise.

name: Pop'n Music Adventure
description: The 15th game in the Pop'n Music franchise.

name: Pop'n Music Animation Melody
description: This home version of Pop'n Music features mainly anime songs. This game was only released in Japan, but is playable if you import it.

name: pop'n music Best Hits
description: This Best Hits version of Pop'n Music features fan favoirtes of the first 6 Pop'n Music games and also some new songs.

name: Super Robot Taisen MX
description: Super Robot Taisen MX is a video game for the PlayStation 2. It is part of the Super Robot Wars series by Banpresto, a division of Bandai, and was released on May 27, 2004. It was later ported to the PlayStation Portable on December 19, 2005, with minor gameplay tweaks, titled Super Robot Wars MX Portable.

name: Hoyle Card Games 2005
description: Card games.

name: Hoyle Card Games 2004
description: Card games.

name: Hoyle Card Games 2002
description: Card games.

name: Little Fighter
description:
The first game of the series. A freeware non story brawler where you can choose from a wide array of characters
In this game, players can choose to play as one of 11 characters. Each character has exactly 3 special moves. Players participate in a battle in three different modes. The game allows for a one on one match, team matches or elimination tournament matches. There can be up to 8 fighters simultaneously on screen. There can be up to 4 human players on the same game. Playing with a joystick is also an available option, making the game more versatile.

name: Soldier Front
description: Soldier Front is a free-to-play multiplayer online FPS developed by Dragonfly and published by Aeria Games.

name: Pop'n Music Carnival
description: The 13th game in the Pop'n Music franchise.

name: Hoyle Casino 3D
description: Different casino games.

name: Hoyle Casino 2007
description: Different casino games.

name: Melty Blood
description:
Tohno Shiki hears of a new series of murders in Misaki similar to the ones that took place in Tsukihime. Whilst searching for the murderer he meets Sion Eltnam Atlasia who initiates a fight with him, attempting to capture him. After the fight she reveals that her reason for attempting to capture him is to get in contact with the "True Ancestor" (referring to Arcueid) so that she may acquire information on the "cure for vampirism". Shiki then decides to help her with this task.

The sequel to the visual novels Tsukihime and Kagetsu Tohya, Melty Blood is a combination visual novel/fighting game. The story moves through a series of fights. Depending on the outcome of each fight, the story will branch in one of two ways. Ultimately this corresponds to the ending of the game.

The first couple of PC releases had adventure style stories with branches and multiple number of endings and a secondary story in arcade mode. Later versions only have the arcade mode, but they have many more characters.

name: Hoyle Card Games 2008
description: Sin descripción

name: Powershot Pinball Constructor
description:
Play against friends or alone on a selection of stylish tables.

Engage Sabotage Mode to disrupt your opponent's game. Compete in team battle or time attack and discover secret areas and mini games. Create your dream table using the first Nintendo DS pinball table editor and share it with your friends.

name: Demon Chaos
description:
It is set in feudal Japan in the 16th century and revolves around a priestess who has been given eternal youth until she exterminates all the demons. She has been given charge of a mystical beast from the gods, Inugami, which is controlled by the player. 
 
The game is in vein of the well known Dynasty Warriors series, in which the player battles crowd after crowd of hostile enemies. The unique aspect of the game is that up to 65,535 enemies can be on-screen at once.

name: Suzumiya Haruhi no Yakusoku
description:
The Kitakousai festival was coming up at school, but the members of the SOS Brigade were running around making the movie out of Haruhi’s idea. What happened at this busy time for the members? Taking place on the backstage that wasn’t shown in the anime, players can enjoy the original story of the game. The secret that leads to the TV anime is now revealed!!

Suzumiya Haruhi no Yakusoku is a visual novel for the PlayStation Portable, mainly based on The Sigh of Haruhi Suzumiya light novel with new and written scenarios exclusively made for the game.

name: Point of Destruction
description: Just your average Snowboarding game for the Gizmondo.

name: Twelve : Legend of Sealed Gods during the Turbulent Age
description: A SRPG in the style of Super Robot Wars and Disgaea with a unic orb system and script by Kawakami Minoru, the writer of Horizon in the Middle of Nowhere.

name: Ragnarok Online 2: The Gate of the World
description: A planned sequel to Ragnarok Online that was canceled in 2010 after a long stint in open beta. It was replaced by Ragnarok Online 2: Legend of the Second.

name: Moe Star: Moeru Toudai Eigojuku
description: Sin descripción

name: Cyber Virus: CinciClassic Edition
description:
Cybervirus is one of the most highly sought-after "lost" games for the Atari Lynx. Now, Songbird has acquired this game from former developer Beyond Games (along with Ultra Vortex and Mechtiles). Finally, a first person mission game for the Atari Lynx!

Cybervirus puts you in the role of the last surviving member of the Demolitions Ops Guerillas (or DOGs) of War. You've got to stop the horde of bio-mechanical nasties that are threating mankind with extinction!

Only 25 units of this limited edition game were made. The game included eight missions, at least two of which did not appear in the future general release of CyberVirus. Both the cartridge label and opening screens indicated this was the special CinciClassic version.

name: No Gravity
description: A 3D Space Shooter.

name: Horizon Zero Dawn: Complete Edition
description:
In an era where machines roam the land and mankind is no longer the dominant species, a young hunter named Aloy embarks on a journey to discover her destiny. Explore a vibrant and lush world inhabited by mysterious mechanized creatures. Embark on a compelling, emotional journey and unravel mysteries of tribal societies, ancient artefacts and enhanced technologies that will determine the fate of this planet and of life itself.

Horizon: Zero Dawn Complete Edition includes Horizon Zero Dawn and the frozen wilds expansion.

name: Chinese Chess: Elephant Game
description: The most popular Chinese board game.

name: The Jetsons: George Jetson and the Legend of Robotopia
description: Sin descripción

name: Ms. Pac-Man: Maze Madness/Pac-Man World
description: Two Pac-Man games on a single cartridge for Game Boy Advance.

name: E.T. Interplanetary Mission
description: Help E.T. save the universe by battling alien enemies and completing puzzles in a total of 25 levels.

name: Hoyle Casino 2006
description: Different casino games.

name: Super Robot Taisen Impact
description: Super Robot Wars Impact is the first SRW game for the Playstation 2. It is an enhanced remake of the three chapters of Compact 2 and contains over 100 stages, making it the longest SRW to date.

name: No Action Jackson
description: Similar in gameplay to many classic Lucas Arts adventures, No Action Jackson is a free indie game created by Britton O'Toole.

name: Gundam Battle Royale
description: Gundam Battle Royale is a game released for the PlayStation Portable. The game was released only in Japan and South Korea on October 5, 2006. The game features many mobile suits and mobile armors from the Universal Century up to and including Zeta Gundam. It is the sequel to Gundam Battle Tactics. A sequel called Gundam Battle Chronicles has been released on 25 October 2007.

name: Pop'n Music 11
description: The 11th game in the Pop'n Music franchise.

name: Pop'n Music Animelo 2
description: Pop'n Music Animelo 2 (Pop'n Music アニメロ2) is a rhythm video game developed by Konami and released on Arcade platforms in 2001 in Japan. It is a spinoff entry in the Pop'n Music series. Unlike the previous Animelo entry, the game didn't have a console release.

name: Pop'n stage
description: 10 panel dancing game made by Konami's internal pop'n music team. One of the rarest rhythm games to ever see an actual release in the arcade market.

name: Chocolatier 2: Secret Ingredients
description: Another simple trading game where players buy chocolate materials and create and sell finished chocolate. Help save Baumeister confections from bankruptcy...again!

name: Ultimate Ride: Disney Coaster
description: Ultimate Ride is a roller coaster video game designed for people to design, engineer, and ride roller coasters. It was released in September 2001 and opened an official website where members could upload their designs and share them with other members.

name: The Fast and The Furious: Drift
description: It's the sequel to The Fast and The Furious. It is sold by Raw Thrills as an upgrade kit that can be used in almost all driving game cabinets; as an upgrade kit for The Fast and The Furious and as a standalone cabinet.

name: Ninpu Sentai Hurricanger
description: A Japanese "power ranger" genre game. Brawler/fighter with a mix of live action cut-scenes.

name: Sierra Soccer
description:
A soccer game released in 1994 by Sierra On-Line.

Falling somewhere between Striker and Sensible Soccer, the game is based around the World Cup draw itself. The game features a very wide view of a convincingly 3D pitch.

name: Trilby: The Art of Theft
description: Stealth/action platformer in the tradition of Flashback. Trilby, the thief protagonist from the "Chzo Mythos" adventure game series, can learn stealth techniques as the player earns better ratings for levels. Created by Ben "Yahtzee" Croshaw using the same engine as one of his other series, 1213.

name: The Sims: Bowling
description: The Sims: Bowling combines a life simulator with a bowling game, where the player must collect points by playing bowling in different game modes in order to set up their home and buy bowling equipment.

name: Discovery Kids: Puppy Playtime
description: Train a puppy to become a "rescue dog" that can work with the police, fire department or lifeguards.

name: EA Sports Fantasy Football Live Draft Tracker
description: The Live Draft Tracker imports league and team information from the website, tracks the draft, and then uploads completed draft results back to the website saving the commish a lot of time and effort. Live Draft Tracker is packed with EA Expert analysis on the top players in the draft and highlight videos from Madden NFL 09.

name: Cowboyana
description:
Cowboyana tells the tales of Billy Blue and Rufus Red as cowboys in the Wild West. They spend their days drinking, getting into fights and duels, sleeping, and running around on top of trains. The game requires two players to play at the same time. The game randomly loads any of the available sequences in a loop with no ending. After each sequence, a short impression in shown in text. 
 
In the drinking game, players both control the same bottle as they try to down as many drinks as possible. They can hinder each other and generally spill half the bottle on the table. At any point during the drinking, they can decide to draw their guns and start a duel. In other sequences, they either fight alone or together, in the desert or on trains. The characters can move around, jump, shoot and reload.

name: Mutant Mudds Collection
description: A compilation that includes "Mutant Mudds Deluxe", "Mutant Mudds Super Challenge" and the new "Mudd Blocks" puzzle game.

name: Ultima Online: Kingdom Reborn
description: Lastest expansion to the Ultima Online MMORPG.

name: Mobile Train Simulator
description: Sin descripción

name: Cyber Org
description: An action adventure game by Squaresoft. Set in a futuristic sci-fi universe, the player switches between 3 members of the Space Investigation Squad, tasked with finding out the fate of a vanished diplomatic vessel.

name: Return to Dark Castle
description: The third installment of this classic Mac series.

name: Tokyo Bus Guide
description: Tokyo Bus Guide is a bus driving simulation for the Sega Dreamcast.

name: EverQuest: Secrets of Faydwer
description: Secrets of Faydwer is the fourteenth expansion for the popular MMORPG, EverQuest.

name: The Super Dimension Fortress Macross: Do You Remember Love?
description: A Macross game based on the film of the same name.

name: EverQuest: Prophecy of Ro
description: Prophecy of Ro is the eleventh expansion for the popular MMORPG franchise, EverQuest.

name: Copernicus
description: The second project from 38 Studios was a massively-multiplayer online game set in their Amalur universe, established in the singleplayer RPG Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning. After 38's collapse, it is unlikely to ever see release.

name: EverQuest: The Serpent's Spine
description: The Serpent's Spine is the twelfth expansion to the popular MMORPG franchise, EverQuest.

name: Heavy Duty
description: In Heavy Duty, you combat aliens to expand your land using giant mechs. The game slated to come out in late 2008 was unfortunately cancelled.

name: Strikers 1945 Plus
description: Strikers 1945 Plus is a shoot 'em up game released by Psikyo in 1999. Make use of Shots, Super Shots, and Support Attacks to make your way through a chaotic dogfight!

name: My Spanish Coach
description: From the makers of My Word Coach, this educational game teaches Spanish through mini-games, and evaluates your progress.

name: Beatmania IIDX 5th style
description: The 5th release in the beatmania IIDX series. Marks the first of many appearances from Namco mainstays sampling masters.

name: Beatmania IIDX 7th style
description: The 7th game in the IIDX series.

name: Beatmania IIDX 6th style
description: The 6th game in the beatmania IIDX series. This version saw a major graphical upgrade in terms of interface and overall polish. Features many licensed tracks from Avex's Super Eurobeat and Cutting Edge sub labels.

name: Operation Shadow
description: Operation Shadow is an ACtion Adventure game for the N-Gage

name: 2025: Battle for Fatherland
description: Futuristic warfare from Akella and Primal Software.

name: Cosmic Rift
description: A 2D bird's eye space fighting game. Take on multiple opponents in a dual of skill with an assortment of weapons, mines and bombs.

name: The Fast and The Furious: Super Bikes
description: F&F Super Bikes is a spin-off of The Fast and The Furious arcade game. Since this game is about motorcycle races, it uses a different cabinet, with a replica of a byke's body, like most motorcycle based arcade games.

name: Shining Wind
description: Shining Wind is the sequel to Shining Tears. The main characters from Shining Tears appear in Shining Wind as well.

name: Empire of Sports
description: Empire of Sports allows you to create your own sports hero.

name: Beatmania IIDX 4th style
description: The 4th game in the beatmania IIDX series. Features a few more licenses from the Dance Express-Hi Speed CD series, as well as covers of popular 80's tracks from some of Konami's in-house artists.

name: Hit the Ice
description: An over-the-top hockey arcade game by Williams that was later ported to consoles.

name: Hoyle Casino 2008
description: Casino games, including Blackjack, Craps, Roulette, Slots and different Poker games.

name: Avatar: Legends of the Arena
description: A global online multiplayer game inspired by Avatar: The Last Airbender released by Nintendo in September 2008.

name: An Untitled Story
description: Players control an egg that explores a vast world. Included is a multiplayer 'Heist Mode' with gameplay very similar to capture-the-flag.

name: The Tripods
description: Released in 1985 as a tie in to the BBC's TV series, adapted from John Christophers series of books.

name: Tennis no Ouji-sama: 2005 Crystal Drive
description: An action-packed tennis game based on the Prince of Tennis series filled with crazy moves and super powers.

name: Nova Usagi no Game de Ryuugaku!? DS
description: Sin descripción

name: Smart Bomb
description: Smart Bomb test your skills, the puzzle game for the PSP developed by Core Design Ltd.

name: Darby the Dragon
description: Darby accidently shrinks his sister using a magic wand, and aims to bring her back to size.

name: Gregory & the Hot Air Balloon
description: Gregory and his pet lizard named Newt crash land in a carnival and have to collect items to get back home.

name: Legions: Overdrive
description: Developed at GarageGames, Inc. Legions is a Tribes-like shooter for InstantAction.com, currently being developed by the community.

name: Strategic Conquest
description: A turn-based strategy game for the Apple II and Macintosh in which players aim to capture the world.

name: Go! Sports Ski
description: Go! Sports Ski is a skiing simulator that harnesses the SIXAXIS wireless controller to twist, turn and pull off tricks. The easy and intuitive motion control allows you to fly down visually stunning slopes right out of the gate. Supporting various single player modes, including slalom racing, a split-screen versus mode and several online battle modes, Go Sports Ski features two distinct courses.

name: Robot Warlords
description: Robot Warlords is a Sci-fi turn based strategy game that was released on the PS2 back on December 14th 2001. It didn't get very good reviews, or sales and, hence, is very very rare.

name: Backyard Skateboarding
description: A re-release of the original Backyard Skateboarding (2004) that featured updated graphics and controls and additional power-ups, sponsors, and gear. It also featured an extra level.

name: Doctor Who Top Trumps
description: A video game based around the Top Trumps card game and the Doctor Who franchise. In addition to regular Top Trumps matches, the game also features a number of mini-games.

name: Master of Illusion Express: Shuffle Games
description: More games from the Master of Illusion game. Uses shuffling.

name: Fuzzee Fever
description: Party game that can be played online on the original Xbox.

name: Silkroad Online
description: Silkroad Online is a free MMORPG made by Joymax that is based on the silkroad trading routes in ancient China.

name: Wolfenstein: Youngblood - Deluxe Edition
description:
Wolfenstein: Youngblood is a brand-new co-op adventure from award-winning studio MachineGames, developers of the critically-acclaimed Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus, in partnership with Arkane Studios Lyon.

The Deluxe Edition includes the Buddy Pass, allowing you and a friend to play the entire game together, even if they don't own the game themselves. This edition also features the Cyborg Skin Pack, which includes: - Cyborg player skin - Titanium alloy skins for all weapons - Titanium alloy hatchet - Titanium alloy knife - Armor-boosting pep signal

name: Taisen!! Ka to Chan no Kororonpe!
description: Korokoro Cubix is a new puzzler for the WiiWare service.

name: Taito Memories II Joukan
description:
Taito Memories Joukan was released in 2005 for the Japanese PS2 and contains 25 of Taito's arcade games from the 80s and early 90s:
- Ah Eikou No Koshien
- Alpine Ski
- Bubble Bobble
- Cameltry
- Cleopatra Fortune
- Darius Gaiden
- Don Doko Don
- Elevator Action Returns
- Flipull
- Grid Seeker
- Jigoku Meguri
- Kiki Kaikai
- Kuri Kinton
- Light Bringer
- Lunar Rescue
- Majestic Twelve: The Space Invaders Part IV
- Metal Black
- Puchi Carat
- PuLiRuLa
- Rastan Saga
- Runark
- Space Invaders Color
- Space Invaders DX
- Syvalion
- The Fairyland Story

name: Starship Catan
description: Computer version of the 2-player board game, with extra scenarios and hot-seat or computer opponents. Players trade, battle pirates, and upgrade their ships in an attempt to win the cooperation of the local species in finding a way back to the players' home system.

name: Remote Control Dandy SF
description: A Japan-only Playstation 2 game in which you play a little boy controlling a giant robot via remote control. Acts as a direct sequel to Remote Control Dandy on PS1.

name: Jet Impulse
description: Jet Impulse, known outside of Japan as the working title DS Air but never released there, is a Nintendo DS amateur flight simulation game.

name: Dance Summit 2001: Bust a Move
description: A dancing rhythm-matching & button recognition game with up-beat Japanese music. PS2 update to the classic Bust a Groove series.

name: Project Hacker
description: The game is a spy game, where among the lobby players have one or more hackers, the crew's goal is to escape while the hacker's goal is to kill or prevent their escape.

name: PickUp Express
description: You pick up and deliver different types of goods all around the city.

name: Discovery Kids: Kitten Corner
description:
Play with a kitten on your DS!
Kitten Corner lets you raise your very own kitten on the Nintendo DS. Choose your favorite breeds and coloring, give them a name and begin playing with them right away! You can buy accessories, toys, and furniture for your new friend... you can even enter your kitten into competitions and prove that your kitten is the best around!

name: Bleach: Heat the Soul 5
description:
Bleach: Heat the Soul 5 is the fifth installment in the Heat the Soul series based on Tite Kubo's Bleach, released on May, 15th 2008 in Japan. Like previous installments it picks off where the other Heat The Soul left off, the story picks up from the entry of Hueco Mundo to the encounter between Grimmjow and Ichigo. New features include a "Tag Action" system and a new way for releasing zanpakutō. Transformations such as Bankai are now made when 2 bars of reiatsu is obtained and then pressing the L button, rather than selecting a character's Bankai form before a fight. There also seems to be 3 styles of tag action: offensive, defensive and technical. There is also a game mode called Tag Master, which lets you choose 2 characters to fight with in a series of fights. The system also includes specials which use the tagged partner's abilities.

The game features 32 characters usable in Tag Battle mode, while extra characters can be obtained with Bleach: Heat The Soul 4 game save through game conversion. However, these characters are only usable in single mode with no in-game transformation. They are selected through a separate menu accessible by pressing L/R in the normal character menu.

name: Operation Mania
description: Operation is an offspring of the partnership between EA and Hasbro based on the Operation board game.

name: Doctor Who: Destiny of the Doctors
description: Destiny of the Doctors is a 1997 PC game based on the British science fiction series Doctor Who.

name: Shadow of Aten
description: Shadow of Aten is an upcoming thriller game where you play as a ex British agent named Allan Scott as he investigates a murder of a famous British archaeologist in the year 1936.

name: Cube Runner
description: An addicting 3-D flight survival game that takes advantage of the iPhone's accelerometer with it's simple left/right controls.

name: The Woodleys Summer Sports
description: The Woodleys Summer Sports is a DS game for young kids.

name: Action-Strategy Baseball
description: A simple, irreverent, addictive, line-drawn baseball game released for the Macintosh in the early 1990's. The game allowed you to create, customize, and share teams, helping foster an early game-centric community.

name: World Soccer: Winning Eleven 9
description: Pro Evolution Soccer 5 (abbreviated PES 5), known as World Soccer: Winning Eleven 9 in Japan and North America (sometimes mislabeled as World Soccer Winning Eleven 9 International), is a 2005 football sports simulation video game developed and produced by Konami as part of the Pro Evolution Soccer series.

name: Pony Luv
description: Own and manage one of six ponies in Pony Luv.

name: Mad Maze
description: Mad Maze was a maze themed adventure game created in 1989 and only available through the Prodigy online service. It was one of the first online games to become successful enough to reach a sizable audience.

name: Professor Brainmaniac
description: Test your logic skills with six mind boggling logic-based puzzles!

name: Space Monster
description: Space invaders type game for the Odyssey 2. When your ship was hit you continued as as a guy and could convert one of the shields into another ship.

name: Planet Harriers
description: Planet Harriers is a seated twin arcade cabinet in the Space Harrier franchise. Like its 1985 predecessor Space Harrier, Planet Harriers had the most technically advanced graphics of 2000, running on the Sega Hikaru arcade system board, which was very powerful (but very expensive) for its time.

name: Docomodake Boing!
description: Sin descripción

name: Backyard Football 2006
description: The 2006 version of the backyard football series

name: Defenders of Law Inc: Crime in Willburg
description: In Defenders of Law, you play as one of five choosable character from a criminal law firm hired to defend the main suspect in the murder of Miss Rosevolt. Search for evidence to defend your client in the courtroom. For the WIi and DS.

name: Shooter: Space Shot
description: A shoot-'em-up that was originally released in Japan under the Simple 1500 Series Banner and later released in the US as a budget title by A1 Games through Agetec.

name: Kabushiki Baibai Trainer Kabutore
description: Sin descripción

name: Rocky's Boots
description: Rocky's Boots is a puzzle game where you must complete electrical circuits, using logic gates (AND, OR, NOT, etc.), to solve mathematical problems. Intended for children, it is actually a great introduction to logic-based programming.

name: Flatspace II
description: Flatspace II is the sequel to the original Flatspace. A top down, Privateer like indie game created by Conrnutopia

name: Two Worlds: The Temptation
description: Two Worlds: The Temptation was to be the sequel to Two Worlds, but has since been canceled and replaced with Two Worlds II, which uses an all-new engine.

name: Lineage Eternal: Twilight Resistance
description: Lineage III is an MMORPG currently in early development. Lineage is known for it's grind, ground breaking graphics and brutal player vs player action.

name: Mobile Suit Gundam 00: Gundam Meisters
description: Sin descripción

name: Bleach: Blade Battlers
description: Bleach ~Blade Battlers~ (BLEACH~ブレイド・バトラーズ~) is a video game for the PlayStation 2 and the first installment in the Blade Battlers series.

name: Tokimeki Memorial
description: You are a young boy who is going to study three years at the Kirameki High School in Japan. Your goal is to win the affection of one (and possibly more) of the twelve beautiful girls who also study with you, especially of Shiori, with whom you were in love some years ago. This is a simulation game with a high-developed statistics system. You have to increase your statistics in different disciplines, depending on the girl you are interested in. You communicate with people via your telephone, and date girls by going with them to various places. You have to keep your promises, otherwise a girl will become angry and even tell bad things about you to other girls, which will spoil your reputation.

name: Super Marathon
description: Super Marathon was a port of Marathon and Marathon 2: Durandal for the Apple Pippin. It was developer Bungie's first console release.

name: Itadaki Street Special
description: The game is similar to Monopoly in that players roll one die to advance around a board, purchase an unowned property they land on and earn money when opponents land on the player's property. The game differs from Monopoly in that players can buy and sell stocks of a block, affecting the value of block's stock up by buying or down by selling that block's stock or by developing a player-owned property of that block which increases the value per share for that block's stock. Also unlike Monopoly, it is not necessary to own the entire block to develop a property, though controlling more than one property of a block allows the player to develop their properties into larger buildings to collect more from opponents when they land on them. Players must collect a set of four suits, heart, diamond, clover and spade, to level up and collect additional gold when the pass the starting position/bank. To win a player must make it back to the bank with the board's required amount, which includes the total value of the player's stocks, property value, and gold on hand.

name: WarDevil: Unleash the Beast Within
description: Designed both as a Blu-ray movie and a video game, WarDevil is a long-in-development action game built for next-generation systems.

name: Aqua Forest
description: This iPhone/iPod Touch game is a puzzle game that uses the accelerometer and lets you play with the elements

name: Pretty In Pink
description: Another movie adaption.

name: Pocket MuuMuu
description: A Playstation title that you played Pocketstation games in order to make money so you could buy more Pocketstation games as well as other little items.

name: Johnny Nero Action Hero
description: Johnny Nero Action Hero is an arcade light gun shooter with a comic book theme developed by I.C.E.

name: Eyeshield 21: Field no Saikyou Senshi-tachi
description: Eyeshield 21: Field Saikyou no Senshi Tachi, translated as Eyeshield 21: The Field's Greatest Warriors in English, is a Nintendo published game released exclusively in Japan in March of 2007. The game is described by GameSpot as a "glimpse into how the Japanese view American football". It alters the rules, adds in Japanese styled Manga characters, and is overall one of the strangest football games ever released. The game stars Sena Kobayakawa, a small person who is great at playing American football.

name: Shrek the Third: Arthur's School Day Adventure
description: Shrek is back on the vsmile to teach children more. On the adventure the game teachs spelling, maths, vocabulary, numbers and problem solving.

name: Superman: The Greatest Hero
description: Superman the super hero here to teach children life saving skills addition, subtraction, science concepts, vocabulary and comprehension

name: Go Diego! Go: Save the Animal Families!
description: Diego is here saving the animals, also teaching children animal recognition, shapes, colors, matching, numbers, logic and problem solving skills.

name: The Backyardigans: Viking Voyage
description: The backyardigans appear in this wonderful viking journey teaching children colours, shapes, numbers and counting, rhyming, size comparisons and memory skills.

name: Spider-Man & Friends: Doc Ock's Challenge
description: Spider-Man helps young children learn science, like mirrors and lenses, and the solar system.

name: SpongeBob SquarePants: A Day in the Life of a Sponge
description: A day in the life of Spongebob teaches children (and Adults) core skills such as spelling, maths, geometry and money skills.

name: Spider-Man & Friends: Secret Missions
description: Join Spider-Man, Spider-Girl and Wolverine on their secret crime-stopping missions! As kids help Spider-Man and his friends, they engage in exciting games and activities that teach key school skills like spelling, counting, problem solving and more. To get these superheroes through four clever learning adventures, kids must master their learning of number sequence, animal names, object identification, problem solving, shape matching, counting and money concepts. Four shorter arcade-style games, focused on letters, pattern matching, classifying and basic math skills, keep kids on target with their learning. Providing hours of thrilling game play, this V. Smile smartridge works with all V. Smile Learning Systems.

name: Scooby-Doo: Funland Frenzy
description: Have fun with Scooby doo while learning Logic, maths and vocabulary skills.

name: They Hunger: Lost Souls
description: First person horror action game made by Black Widow Games; the creators of They Hunger trilogy. Designed using the Source engine.

name: Thomas and Friends: Engines Working Together
description: Thomas and his friends teaching young children spelling, logic, vocabulary and number patterns.

name: Hourglass of Summer
description: Hourglass of Summer is a visual novel wherein a boy begins inexplicably traveling through random intervals of his summer vacation. Discovering that the girl he likes will die before the summer's end, he must do everything in his power to prevent this future from coming to be.

name: Instruments of Chaos Starring Young Indiana Jones
description: Instruments of Chaos Starring Young Indiana Jones is an action/adventure game with platforming elements. In it you control the titular character through missions around the world.

name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2005
description: The 2005 installment of the wrestling sim series; the first of which released under the Grey Dog Software hood. This game has been released as Freeware.

name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2004
description: The inaugural commercial installment of the wrestling sim series. It is no longer available with the closing of .400 Software Studios.

name: Korg DS-10
description:
KORG DS-10 is a music creation program for the Nintendo DS that emulates the Korg MS range of synthesizers.

The DS-10 creates sound with two analogue synthesizer emulators, each with two Voltage-Controlled Oscillators (the Korg MS-10 had only one VCO). The VCOs feature a sawtooth, a pulse (with a non-modifiable pulse width), a triangle and a noise waveform. There is also a four-part drum machine that uses the same sound creation techniques as the synthesizers. The sounds made by each of the synthesizer emulators are modified using virtual knobs to change the value of standard synthesizer parameters such as cutoff frequency and waveform shape. Additionally there is a screen where users can patch certain parameters to be modified by an LFO, the envelope generator, or VCO2.

name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2008
description: The 2008 installment of the wrestling sim series.

name: Huxley: The Dystopia
description:
Huxley: The Dystopia was published by Webzen in Korea, and internatinally in 2010 after NHN USA stopped hosting its beta. It was developed by Webzen;s H-Studio.

Huxley was a MMO first-person shooter with a focus on cinematic action and multiplayer clan battles.
It was shutdown in 2010 after 7 months of open beta in Korea.
A Xbox 360 version was being planned in 2008 but was put on hiatus later on.

The game had 2 English closed beta tests though a partnership with NHN USA before separating with an announcement in 2010 that Webzen would take over the international publishing.

The game was shutdown/canceled on December 30th, 2010.
